page.title: 02Northill:Landscape/Buildings
page.content: Mox Hill breaks the monotony of the otherwise{flat landscape of Northill, with its many woods & mostly arable land with some meadows. Most fields are bordered by hedges and trees. The area has{2 tributaries of the Ivel}and some man-made{reservoirs and ponds. {Houses}are of various architectural styles,{many typical of their era,viz. The Grange(Queen Anne), Highlands Farm (Georgian),the pre-war council houses. There are some 16th and 17th century timber-framed thatched or tiled houses (mainly extended),e.g.Cowhovel Row and The Old Brewhouse. Many private houses have been built postwar, but few prior to 1930. The only{mansion}is Park Hos- pital. All pre-1800 and other unusual houses have been{listed Grade II}in 1985, e.g. house on stilts, lapboard house. Cottages in Sand Lane & a Tudor thatched one at Budna need renovation.
